definition: to cook on a slow fire/to extract by heating/to decoct/to endure

sentences.english: By the end of our third year I was itching to expand again.
sentences.chinese: 到了第三年年底，我又心癢難熬地想再去擴充。

sentences.english: Person's life is too short, not regret the day too, only sad moment.
sentences.chinese: 人之一生何其短，不悔朝夕易過，只悲分秒難熬。

sentences.english: At night he would lie sleepless on his cot, suffering an almost unbearable frustration.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他躺在行軍牀上睡不着覺，灰心喪氣難熬難捱。

sentences.english: Choose a close friend to help you through the white-knuckle times of this journey.
sentences.chinese: 找個好朋友一起戒菸有助於度過這難熬的過程。

sentences.english: As an apprentice the boy lived a life of grinding poverty.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子當學徒時過着貧困難熬的生活。

sentences.english: Du Toit admits there are dark days.
sentences.chinese: 杜託伊特承認，有一些難熬的日子。

sentences.english: It is particularly difficult to bear up against the midsummer heat.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏酷暑尤其令人難熬。

sentences.english: Unlike last year's terrible weather, it's unusually cool this late summer.
sentences.chinese: 今年夏末格外的爽氣，不像去年那麼難熬。

sentences.english: I find this hot weather very trying.
sentences.chinese: 我感到這種炎夏天氣很難熬苦楚。

sentences.english: With his help, I underwent the hardest time and devoted myself to the piano at last.
sentences.chinese: 最後我度最難熬的一段，全身心投入到練琴中。

sentences.english: Melissa was desperately lonely since her best friend had married and moved away.
sentences.chinese: 梅麗颯感到難熬地孤寂，最好的朋友因結婚而搬走了。

sentences.english: One of our concerns before sailing was that we'd find the days long.
sentences.chinese: 我們啓程之前的一個擔憂就是會覺得日子太長而難熬。

sentences.english: Yeah, and so is being alone on Christmas!
sentences.chinese: 是的，但是獨自過聖誕節也是很難熬的。

sentences.english: The difficult days are the result of the sloughing off of a dense vibration that is tremendously discordant.
sentences.chinese: 難熬的日子是蛻去那些特別不和諧的緻密振動的結果。

sentences.english: The old couple passed the seven-year itch a long time ago.
sentences.chinese: 這對老夫婦，早就度過七年難熬症。

sentences.english: It must have been difficult to go through life immersed in paranoia and fear.
sentences.chinese: 把一生都沉浸在偏執和恐懼裏一定是很難熬的。

definition: to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
